Detailed Description

Interface for Player.

Each player should implement setBoardData(), startMove() and stopMove().

Player should emit signal moved() to perform the move. Player may emit signal selectionChanged() to update selection indication on board.

Examples of possible players:

  • Human player (see ChHumanPlayer)
  • Computer player
  • Remote network player
  • etc.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

ChPlayer::setBoardData ( const ChBoardData *  boardData  )  [pure virtual]

Called to provide to the Player the reference to board data.

Parameters:
boardData - reference to board data.

Implemented in ChHumanPlayer.

ChPlayer::startMove (  )  [pure virtual]

Called to inform Player that it is time to perform move.

When move is ready then the signal moved() should be emitted by the Player.

Implemented in ChHumanPlayer.

ChPlayer::stopMove (  )  [pure virtual]

Called to inform Player that it should stop thinking about move.

After stopMove() call the Player should not emit selectionChanged() and moved() signals.

Implemented in ChHumanPlayer.

ChPlayer::moved ( int  from,
int  to 
) [signal]

Signal to inform about move.

The signal should be emitted by the Player to provide data about the move.

Parameters:
from - index to move piece from. See ChSquare about indexes.
to - index to move piece from.

ChPlayer::selectionChanged ( int  selected,
const ChSquares &  highlighted 
) [signal]

Signal to inform about piece selected to move.

The signal may be emitted by the Player to provide information about possible piece moves.

Parameters:
selected - index of the piece to move or -1.
highlighted - indexes of possible move target squares.
